stimulusHtml: (a) Find the acceleration of the particle at time \(t=5.1\).

features.html:
A GRAPHING CALCULATOR IS REQUIRED FOR THIS QUESTION.

A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at time t is given by \(v\left(t\right)=\frac{t^6-13t^4\ +\ 12}{10t^3\ +\ 3}\). At time \(t=0\), the initial position of the particle is \(x=7\).

stimulusHtml: (b) Find all values of \(t\) in the interval \(0\le t\le2\) for which the speed of the particle is 1.

features.html:
A GRAPHING CALCULATOR IS REQUIRED FOR THIS QUESTION.

A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at time t is given by \(v\left(t\right)=\frac{t^6-13t^4\ +\ 12}{10t^3\ +\ 3}\). At time \(t=0\), the initial position of the particle is \(x=7\).

stimulusHtml: (c) Find the position of the particle at time \(t=4\). Is the particle moving toward the origin or away from the origin at time \(t=4\) ? Justify your answer.

features.html:
A GRAPHING CALCULATOR IS REQUIRED FOR THIS QUESTION.

A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at time t is given by \(v\left(t\right)=\frac{t^6-13t^4\ +\ 12}{10t^3\ +\ 3}\). At time \(t=0\), the initial position of the particle is \(x=7\).

stimulusHtml: (d) During the time interval \(0 < t\le4\), does the particle return to its initial position? Give a reason for your answer.

features.html:
A GRAPHING CALCULATOR IS REQUIRED FOR THIS QUESTION.

A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at time t is given by \(v\left(t\right)=\frac{t^6-13t^4\ +\ 12}{10t^3\ +\ 3}\). At time \(t=0\), the initial position of the particle is \(x=7\).
